intro: Melasma hispidum, commonly known as the hairy melasma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
